content:
I noticed that, in the dark theme, links seem hard to read on top of the lighter background we use for PMs. Do folks agree? Should we play with the color to make them stand out more? (Of course, you can read the link if you zoom way in by opening the screenshot in the lightbox.)

Screen-Shot-2022-03-11-at-11.52.08-AM.png
I'm not super excited about changing the link color itself, though that's an option; the other direction we could go in is tweaking the background color itself.
The link looks too "grey" to me, whatever exactly that means in terms of CSS/transparency/etc.

Alya Abbott said:

The link looks too "grey" to me, whatever exactly that means in terms of CSS/transparency/etc.

Yes, I agree with both of you, we can improve this. If we make the background brighter then the contrast between normal text and background will decrease. But if we make the background slightly darker and the link's color a bit brighter, it will improve the current situation.
I suggest:
For Link - #26B8FF
For Background - #34404A
image.png
I'd want to experience it to fully get a feel for it, but that looks a lot more readable to me! @Vlad Korobov what do you think?
Agree
@Sahil Harpal would you like to make a PR?

Hm, that certainly looks more readable. Could you please post the following to make it easier to review?

  1. Both current and proposed colors for all the elements you're touching.
  2. A screenshot with PMs, non-PMs and @-mentions next to each other. Since the purpose of the background differences is to make different message types easy to distinguish, we need to check that it's still doing that job.

Thanks!
